topic.title: Extended Attributes
topic.shortdesc: Couchbase Server permits the definition of extended attributes on individual documents. These are JSON key-value pairs, containing meta-data; which can be made accessible only by selected users. The SDK supports extended attributes by means of extensions to the Subdocument API: this allows extended attributes to be defined, searched for, edited, removed, and more.

section.title: Using Extended Attributes
section.p: Extended attributes allow a document to be identified or classified through customized meta-data that remains invisible to most users. Extended attributes might therefore be used to facilitate programmatic handling of specific data-configurations; or to maintain revision histories; or to record proprietary relationships between customers and document-described commercial entities.

The SDK supports extended attributes by means of extensions to the Subdocument API: so that extended attributes can be defined, searched for, edited, removed, and more. In order to specify that a subdocument operation should be performed on an extended rather than a regular attribute, an xattr flag should be set to true, by the calling application.
